questions.question: What is the primary role of a Hardware Description Language (HDL) like VHDL or Verilog in digital IC design?
options: To compile software programs for microcontrollers.
To describe the behavior and structure of digital circuits.
To perform physical layout and routing automatically.
To simulate analog circuit performance.
To manage project timelines and resources.

questions.question: In the context of digital IC design, what is the main objective of Static Timing Analysis (STA)?
options: To simulate the power consumption of the entire chip under various workloads.
To verify the functional correctness of the design by applying test vectors.
To identify all potential signal integrity issues like crosstalk.
To ensure that all timing constraints (e.g., setup and hold times) are met without running dynamic simulations.
To determine the optimal placement of standard cells on the silicon.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of implementing branch prediction in a pipelined processor?
options: To reduce the overall power consumption of the CPU.
To minimize the number of functional units required in the execution stage.
To prevent data hazards by reordering instructions.
To avoid pipeline stalls caused by control hazards when encountering conditional branches.
To increase the overall memory bandwidth for data fetching.

questions.question: In modern ASIC design, what is the main purpose of 'power gating' techniques?
options: To precisely control the operating voltage of individual logic gates.
To detect and mitigate transient voltage spikes on the power delivery network.
To completely shut off power to inactive parts of the chip, reducing static and dynamic power consumption.
To distribute power and ground signals evenly across the chip area.
To optimize the clock tree network for minimal skew.

questions.question: What defines an Instruction Set Architecture (ISA)?
options: The physical layout and pinout of a microprocessor package.
The complete set of micro-operations executed by the CPU's control unit.
The abstract interface between the hardware and the lowest-level software, specifying instructions, registers, and memory model.
The specific technology used to fabricate the processor (e.g., CMOS, FinFET).
The speed at which instructions are fetched, decoded, and executed.
